newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Philippines' bellwether 92-day T-bill rate rises.
newsitem.headline: Philippines' bellwether 92-day T-bill rate rises.

text.p: The Philippines' bellwether 92-day Treasury bill rose slightly to 11.593 percent at Monday's regular weekly auction from last week's 11.536 percent, the Bureau of Treasury said.
The auction committee had to add one day to the regular 91-day tenor since the 91st day will fall on January 1 next year, a national holiday.
The committee accepted only 800 million pesos out of the 2.7 billion pesos tendered by financial institutions.

The average rate for 182-day T-bills also went up to 12.004 as against 11.937 percent in the previous auction. Total awards reached 2.0 bilion pesos, while bids for the six-month bills totalled 2.67 billion pesos.
The 364-day T-bill also rose to 12.919 percent from 12.846 percent posted last week.
The committee accepted 2.5 billion pesos out of the 6.305 billion pesos worth of tenders.
